intro: Damnxanthodium calvum, commonly known as the smooth damnxanthodium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, powdery coating. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
